revised_title: Ray Paths and Caustics on a Slightly Oblate Ellipsoid: A 4-Star Hypocycloid
tldr: The author investigates ray paths from a point source on a slightly oblate ellipsoidal shell and discovers that the caustics form a 4-star hypocycloid. The lengthscale of the 4-star varies with the eccentricity and latitude of the antipodal point. This study has implications for understanding wave propagation in various media, such as oceans and ionospheres.
